decks.notes: The deck focuses on using the powerful ramp provided by cards like Primeval Titan and Arboreal Grazer to quickly assemble the combo of Amulet of Vigor and Azusa, Lost but Seeking. This allows for explosive plays like chaining land drops and casting multiple spells in the same turn. The deck also utilizes unique lands like Lotus Field and Urza's Saga to further enhance its ramp capabilities. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and a consistent stream of threats, while also having the ability to protect key combo pieces with Boseiju, Who Endures.

This deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude to bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield quickly. By controlling the opponent's hand with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and countering their spells with Force of Negation, the deck aims to set up a quick and powerful combo win condition. The deck also utilizes card draw and recursion with Ephemerate and Faithful Mending to maintain a consistent game plan while controlling the board with removal spells like Prismatic Ending.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Boros creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy involves employing cards like Ajani, Galvanic Discharge, and Goblin Bombardment to deal damage efficiently while maintaining board control. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury serves as a potent finisher, while support cards like Voice of Victory and Static Prison help disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to establish an early advantage in the game and press that advantage to secure a swift victory.

This aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents' game plans with cards that can exile threats, bounce permanents, and counter spells. It also includes powerful creatures like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly close out games. Teferi, Time Raveler and other spells provide additional tempo advantages. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana. This deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game, overwhelming opponents with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying threats that can quickly close out the game. With cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's strategy, combined with aggressive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, this deck aims to apply constant pressure while controlling the board. The deck also utilizes powerful flicker effects like Ephemerate to generate value from enter-the-battlefield abilities on cards like Solitude and Quantum Riddler. By combining disruption and aggression, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

This deck focuses on a combination of aggro tactics and disruptive elements to control the opponent's board. It utilizes creatures like Phelia and Ragavan to apply pressure, while cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending are used to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Consign to Memory and Solitude provide removal options, while Quantum Riddler can provide card advantage. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the inclusion of a variety of colors allows for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent while keeping them off balance with disruptive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by utilizing cards that tax their resources, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending, while also making use of creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Quantum Riddler and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Spell Snare allow for additional disruption and protection.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a variety of counterspells, disruptive spells, and card draw to control the game while setting up for a game-winning combo with Goblin Charbelcher. The deck aims to create a situation where the opponent's resources are depleted and their strategy disrupted, allowing for a powerful finish with the Charbelcher. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect to provide additional control and disruption options. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while building toward a powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Lightning Bolt, and Lava Dart, the deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble. The inclusion of cards like Violent Urge and Slickshot Show-Off allow for additional damage and versatility in combat situations. Overall, the deck focuses on applying early pressure and maintaining momentum throughout the game.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on using cheap and efficient spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage at a fast pace. It includes cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Lightning Bolt, and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure early on. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection with cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble to maintain a consistent stream of threats. By combining burn spells with aggressive creatures, this deck aims to close out games swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient spells and creatures. By utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on. The inclusion of cards like Mutagenic Growth and Slickshot Show-Off allows for additional damage and combat tricks to overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is designed to support casting spells efficiently and consistently throughout the game.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board through hand disruption and targeted removal spells. It also utilizes creatures with powerful and versatile abilities to pressure the opponent and provide additional disruption. The deck's strategy is focused on tempo and resource denial, while also presenting a proactive and aggressive game plan to close out the game quickly. With a mix of disruption, removal, and strong creatures, it looks to efficiently dismantle the opponent's strategies and secure victory through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, countermagic, and planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nahiri, the Harbinger. It also includes powerful win conditions like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and March of Otherworldly Light. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up resources and eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats. The land base includes cards like Field of Ruin and Flooded Strand to manage the opponent's mana base and ensure smooth color fixing.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the board with artifacts to enable powerful synergies and generate card advantage. It uses efficient threats like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary, along with powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives, to overwhelm opponents. The strategy is to disrupt opponents with cards like Pithing Needle and Metallic Rebuke, while also maintaining a high level of consistency through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. The deck aims to outpace opponents and close out games aggressively.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies and gaining tempo advantage by using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Ephemerate to control the board. The deck also includes creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk, Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, and Solitude to apply pressure and close out games quickly. By utilizing a combination of disruption, efficient creatures, and powerful spells, this deck aims to disrupt opponents' plans while quickly overwhelming them with aggressive threats.

This deck heavily focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and medallions to cast multiple spells in a turn. With Ral, Monsoon Mage as a key piece, the deck aims to chain spells together to generate a storm count and deal lethal damage with cards like Grapeshot. The deck also includes card draw and filtering effects to find key combo pieces. By efficiently managing resources and timing spells correctly, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells in a single turn.
